entry.title: Re: Triggering Reconfigure Action on Custom Field Change
entry.content:
Hi @Yogananda, thank you for the response on this!

The business requirement is to automatically reconfigure the items on the quote upon update of a certain custom field.

Hence, I was trying to create a script which triggers reconfigure action on custom field change event - I cannot trigger reconfigure as it is not available through API. I tried a work around by using item refresh action instead on every item on the quote using the same script on custom field change but getting the Msg.QuoteAlreadyModified error.

Can you explain further on the "Go to Workflow/Approval - Reconfigure - Global Condition - use CTX tag to execute script with providing your global script.. ". Edit: Found the ExecuteScript CTX tag, however, I think I want the other way around, trigger reconfigure in a global script/custom field update.

For pre action/post action, there is no action for changing custom field where I can attach a script, or is there?

entry.title: Shape What‚Äôs Next with SAP Integration Suite at TechEd 2025
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community! üöÄ SAP TechEd 2025 is almost here!
Get ready to explore how we‚Äôre shaping the future of integration. Learn how SAP Integration Suite delivers on end-to-end integration requirements, discover how we‚Äôre driving modernization for customers, and see how enterprise automation can unlock new opportunities for your business.

Don‚Äôt miss the chance to gain insights, connect with experts, and experience the innovations that will power the next generation of intelligent enterprises. Join us at SAP TechEd 2025‚Äîin Berlin or virtually!

üö®Save the date and register today:  November 4-6, 2025 SAP TechEd Berlin | SAP TechEd Virtual 

What is in SAP Integration Suite track?

SAP Integration Suite empowers developers to drive innovation with an integration platform as a service (iPaaS) on SAP Business Technology Platform, which unifies on-premises and cloud-based systems, applications, events, and data. Discover how AI-powered capabilities in SAP Integration Suite can help harmonize user experiences and improve developer productivity and operational excellence across complex and diverse IT landscapes.

Take a look at our overall SAP Integration Suite sessions üëá 

 

Strategy Talk Sessions:

ST102 | AI in action: driving innovation and transforming integrations

ST100 | Modernize SAP Business Suite transformation with SAP Integration Suite

ST101 | SAP Integration Suite: Strategy and insights for the modern enterprise

 

Roadmap Sessions:

IN800 | Innovations, investments, and future road map for SAP Integration Suite

IN801 | Use SAP Process Integration and Orchestration to SAP Integration Suite

IN824 | Harnessing AI, APIs, and events for strategic integration and innovation

 

Hands-on Sessions:

IN160 | Empower your business through enterprise automation

IN161 | Modernize and transform your integration to the cloud

IN162 | Real-time data for AI agents: Grounding with event-driven architecture

IN163 | Implement exactly once in-order delivery in SAP Integration Suite

IN166 | Central monitoring of integration scenarios with the SAP Cloud ALM solution

IN164 | Getting started with Integration Advisor and Trading Partner Management

IN260 | Master integrations: Integration Advisor and Trading Partner Management

IN165 | Experience event-driven integration with advanced event mesh

 

Deep Dive sessions: 

IN100 | Make your enterprise future ready with SAP Integration Suite

IN101 | Understand key concepts to accelerate B2B integrations

IN200 | Empower your agents to be responsible

IN201 | Enterprise integration artifact development with AI-driven optimizations

IN300 | Accelerate connectivity for your applications

IN103 | Helping systems talk smarter with a flexible event-driven architecture

IN301 | Streamline the development and governance of your integration strategy

IN302 | Run integration scenarios in private landscapes with Edge Integration Cell

 

Visit our booths at Berlin:

IN906 | Move from SAP PO/PI to SAP Integration Suite

IN907 | Unify everything with SAP Integration Suite

üîçDon't miss out! Explore the TechEd 2025 session catalog and ensure your favorite SAP Integration Suite track sessions are on your list. We're excited to connect with you at the upcoming TechEd sessions. 

Don't know how to build your TechEd agenda? Learn more from this blog post: Put your thinking cap on! It‚Äôs time to make some tough choices‚Ä¶ 

‚ú®We can‚Äôt wait to see you there in Berlin!

entry.title: ServiceKey grant permissions to only specific iflows ?
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community,

I have a general question regarding the SAP Integration Suite.

Currently, we generate a ServiceKey to allow HTTP access to our iFlows from outside. Is there a way to restrict HTTP access using the ServiceKey to only specific iFlows?

As we understand it, a single ServiceKey currently grants access to all endpoints, which can be a security concern. Are there any best practices or configuration options to limit access for a ServiceKey to specific iFlows only? Thank you very much in advance for your support!

entry.title: What is the organizational level of Warehouse Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud
entry.content:
Hi all,

We recently activated Warehouse Management in our project, and I often get the question about where exactly WM sits in the organizational structure what level. From what I understand:

  • You first create a storage location that is WM-relevant (for example, 105W).

  • Then, you connect a warehouse number (for example, 1050) to that storage location so that WM can be activated.

My questions are:

  1. How should we understand the level of the warehouse number (1050) compared to the WM storage location (105W) and standard IM storage locations (like 101A) is 105W and 101A the same level and warehouse number just different entity with lower level?

  2. Is it possible to create a warehouse number and connect it directly to a plant, without going through a storage location?

Thanks 

Faisal Maayeh

entry.title: How to Create and Manage Blanket or Framework Purchase Orders in SAP S/4HANA
entry.content:
Every organisation faces situations where certain goods pr services are required on a recurring basis. Think of office supplies, annual service contracts, or even utility payments, the demand is frequent , but the exact quantity or schedule isn't always predictable. Managing these thoroughly standard purchase orders can quickly become an administrative burden, as each request requires a new document, approval cycle, and follow-up.

To address this, SAP provides the Blanket (Framework) Purchase Order functionality, a powerful tool that streamlines repetitive procurement by consolidating requirements into a single long[-term agreement with defined validity and value limits.

In short, a Blanket PO serves as an umbrella contract: one agreement, multiple call-offs, controlled spend, and minimal effort.

Why Blanket Purchase Order Matter?

  • üöÄ Efficiency: Eliminate repetitive paperwork for recurring needs.
  • üéØ Flexibility: Draw down as needed within agreed limits and validity
  • üí∞Spend Control: Enforce budget caps with clear traceability
  • ‚úÖ Streamlined Approvals: Approve once, transact many times
  •  ü§ù Stronger Vendor Relationships: Ensure continuity and trust through consolidated commitments.

Business Scenario

Let's consider a Manufacturing company that needs office supplies such as stationary, printer cartridges, and cleaning materials throughout the year.

Without Blanket PO:

  • Every time suppliers are required, the buyer has to raise a purchase requisition, convert it into a PO, and route it for approvals. This mean delays, repeated approvals, and additional effort.

With Blanket PO:

  • The buyer creates a single PO valid for 12 months, capped at Rs. 5,00,000/-. Departments can call off against this PO until either the value limit or validity date is reached.

Result: Faster processing, reduced paperwork, tighter cost control , and complete visibility of spend. 

Step-by-Step Process in SAP S/4 HANA

Step 1: Define Number Ranges for POs

Path: SPRO > Materials Management > Purchasing > Purchase Order > Define Number Ranges for POs

Step 2: Define Document Types

Path: SPRO > Materials Management > Purchasing > Purchase Order > Define Document Types for Purchase Orders

Step 3: Create Framework Purchase Order (Transaction: ME21N or Create PO- Advanced)

Enter Header Data (Org Elements, validity dates under Additional Data)

In Item Data

  • Item Category: B - Limits
  • Account Assignment:
    • "K - Cost Center" (If known) or
    • "U - Unknown" (If account assignment will be defined later during posting invoice)

In Item Details (Limits)

  • Define overall value limit and expected amount
  • Maintain G/L account and cost center

Save Purchase Order PO #650003

Step 4: Post Invoices (Transaction: MIRO)

Since item category B disables Goods Receipt, invoices are posted directly.

Enter PO number and and vendor invoice details

Add invoice amount details in account assignment

Enter the amount and navigate to simulate 

Save Invoice #5105600817

Step 5: Review the Invoice Document

FI postings and follow-on documents can be monitored

Note: If the maximum limit is reached, the system will notify the user, preventing further postings.

 

Conclusion

Blanket (Framework) purchase order are not just a technical feature, they're a procurement strategy. By reducing repetitive work, enabling better spend control, and ensuring smooth vendor collaboration, Blanket POs significantly improve operational efficiency in SAP S/4 Hana.

 

If you found this guide helpful, don‚Äôt miss my other SAP MM WM blogs covering real-world automation, configuration tips, and best practices for procurement, inventory management, and warehouse management.

Click to view other SAP MM WM Blogs - SAP Community

 

Regards,

Mannem Leelamohan

entry.title: PPDS Moving Production Orders out by 3 months incorrectly
entry.content:
Help! 

Our planning horizon in PPDS is 12 weeks. The time fence is 4 weeks. We have issues with production orders moving, when we are doing campaigns and want to override the optimisation, in some cases we fix the orders. Once the orders come within the 4 week time fence, they unfix (I believe) and then jump out to a date 3 months away. This could impact dry goods availablity if not caught. We are monitoring this daily but it is not ideal and our IT department is under-resourced currently. Has anyone had any experience of this? Our Strategy Profile is SAP001 which I believe is standard. If anyone has the logic behind this, that would be really helpful.

Thank you,

Deirdre

entry.title: Re: How to handle RV61Axx price condition rules these days?
entry.content:
Hi @patrick_weber11 

Thank you for your question.

Please refer to KBA 2885513, Custom Logic,

https://www.saptechsolutions.com/pdf/VOFMFormulaRoutines.pdf,

https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-q-a/vofm-to-create-a-formula-routine/qaq-p/2259309 for more details.

To summarise, SAP offers a modern, clean-core compliant framework, which has made the classic way of enhancing pricing logic with RV61xx routines no longer possible. They are no longer allowed. Due to the clean-core approach:

  • You can use the functionality of the pricing custom formula which is implemented through the released BadIs such as condition value and requirement routines.
  • These are configured through CBS/SSCUI and implemented with the Custom Logic app and thereby ensure you avoid any system modification.
  • The same framework is also available in S4HANA 2023 FP1 on-premise. So, you can replace RV61Axx routines in your on-premise system and prepare for a cloud-read setup.

This ensures you remain consistent across public cloud and on-premise, while elimination modification in the system and keeping your pricing logic upgrade stable.

I hope this provides the desired insight.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Help Needed : Your apps are affected by Google Play's...
entry.content:
We are also affected by this. We have a total of 2 Kapsel applications affected, and possibly 3 MDK apps also (we are still investigating this).

I have not seen any clear comms from SAP on what dependencies in the native stack are affected.

Currently we see in emulator testing a startup warning. We expect the apps may be unstable or even only partially functional.

To clarify, it also appears that Google is now going to enforce this on November 1st 2025, not May 2026 as previously stated, possibly leading to catastrophic issues for many customers and developers.

I suggest raising an incident for this with a high priority, as we will be doing the same.

entry.title: Multiple Table views in Fiori App via RAP not working
entry.content:
I tried to get Multiple Table Views via RAP, in an OData V4 Fiori App, but it is not working.

In the metadata annotation I added the following in bold: 

@ui: { headerInfo: { title:{ value: 'MissionNeedsNumber' }, typeName: 'Product List', typeNamePlural: 'Product Lists', description:{ value: 'MissionName' } },

presentationVariant: [{ sortOrder: [{ by: 'MissionNeedsNumber', direction: #DESC }], visualizations: [{type: #AS_LINEITEM}] } ],

selectionVariant: [ {

text: 'completed (2 Ranges)',

qualifier: 'Completed'

},

{

text: 'In Process',

qualifier: 'InProcess'

} ] }

@ui.createHidden: #(hide_create)

annotate view zc_mn_missionneeds with

 

Source: https://github.com/SAP-samples/fiori-elements-feature-showcase/blob/main/README.md#general-features

In the metadata xml in can see it is getting loaded when opening the App. See bold part.

 

</Annotation>
<Annotation Term="SAP__UI.SelectionVariant" Qualifier="InProcess">
<Record>
<PropertyValue Property="Text" String="In Process"/>
</Record>
</Annotation>
<Annotation Term="SAP__UI.SelectionVariant" Qualifier="Completed">
<Record>
<PropertyValue Property="Text" String="completed (2 Ranges)"/>
</Record>
</Annotation>
<Annotation Term="Communication.Contact">

 

 Still, there are no text tabs on the List screen.

 

What am I doing wrong? Of course I don't do an actual selection yet, but I at least expected the text tabs to be present on the App list screen.

entry.title: Re: How to retrieve data for Business Partner (Customer (...
entry.content:
Hello @yahaha 

The fields you highlighted are in Japan: Invoice Summary within the customer master. SAP‚Äôs help confirms their exact location. SAP Help Portal-Maintaining Invoice Summary Data for Customers

Simple steps to verify quickly

First option to retrieve: API_BUSINESS_PARTNER entity A_CustomerCompany for the Business Partner and company code. Check the API‚Äôs $metadata in your tenant to see if the Japan-specific attributes are exposed. Not all country fields are available in every tenant check SAP Business Accelerator Hub

If not exposed in the API, use the View Browser to locate a released CDS view that contains the Invoice Summary fields. If found, wrap it with Custom CDS Views and publish via a Custom Communication Scenario to expose it as OData for your integration.

Connectivity for API_BUSINESS_PARTNER utilises SAP_COM_0008. Ensure you create the communication arrangement prior to making the call service. SAP Help Portal-Create Communication Arrangement for Business Partner Replication

Hope it helps,otherwise feel free to let me know

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: SAP CPI: Retrieve Iflow unique id(reg_id) via IFlow (workspace.svc/ContentEntities.ContentPackages)
entry.content:
Dear experts, 

There is an internal (unofficial) API for SAP CPI artifacts. 

https://<your-host>.hana.ondemand.com/odata/1.0/workspace.svc/ContentEntities.ContentPackages('<your-package>')/Artifacts?&$format=json

In comparison to the official API, it for packages it will give you an internal ID of an Iflow (reg_id). 
In browser, once one is logged into CPI, entering the URL will respond with JSON data back. 
But how to execute that in an automated Iflow?
I already tried to create OAuth2 (Code) credentials, read the Token via script and authenticate via Header. It did not work. 
Any hint, example is more than welcome.

thank you & kind regards | Simon

entry.title: My expert playlist, SAP TechEd, Virtual
entry.content:
Hi Community!

This year‚Äôs SAP TechEd Virtual is a great opportunity to explore the latest in application development. Since my main interests are SAP Fiori, CAP, and RAP, I‚Äôve put together my expert playlist of sessions to watch.

Key Notes

KEY100v | Beyond the hype: How SAP is supercharging developers for what's next
Discover how developers remain essential in the AI era and how SAP‚Äôs tools help us adapt.
 
KEY101v | Draft day for developers: Turning new technology into real-world wins
Learn how SAP‚Äôs newest tools and AI innovations accelerate coding, automation, and scaling.
 

Sessions

AD104v | Boost your ABAP development with Joule for developers
Explore SAP‚Äôs ABAP AI strategy, from faster development to custom AI scenarios using Joule.
 
AD106v | The art and science of SAPUI5 in SAP Build
Discover what‚Äôs new in SAPUI5 and SAP Build, including developer tools, Joule integration, and UI strategy with SAP Web Components.
 
ST109v | SAP Build: ABAP Cloud strategy
Learn about SAP‚Äôs ABAP Cloud strategy, covering ABAP AI, custom code transformation, integration with the SAP Business Data Cloud, IDE strategy, and support for the sovereign cloud.
 
AD820v | Future of app dev in SAP Build: Simplifying clean core and LoB extensions
See upcoming SAP Build enhancements with Joule copilot, CAP, SAPUI5, and SAP Fiori apps to boost productivity and extensibility.
 

 Call to action

entry.title: SAP Credit Management - 1QM
entry.content:
We are using SAP public cloud 2 SL system. We are using basic and advanced credit management scope items. We have a business requirement to setup a temporary credit limit in the system. After the validity expires system need to consider the original credit limit. We are planning to use further information field in credit segment data to update the temporary credit limit as a high season credit limit.

We would like to get recommendations on the following.

1. Is there any other alternative standard functionality available
2. Is it possible to trigger approval work flow when we update further information tab
3. How the high season credit limit is set. Are we updating directly in BP master data or is there any alternative apps like manage credit limit reques

Thanks in Advance.

entry.title: From Backlogs to Breakthroughs: What ABAP AI Means for Project Delivery
entry.content:
Hello everyone ! I am Shruthi, a Project Manager of BTP ABAP AI, and I am just about to celebrate my first anniversary with my team. Looking back at this past year, I feel so grateful for the people I work with, the projects we have delivered, and the way we have grown together. 

One thing I have noticed time and again is how small changes‚Äîlike a new validation rule, a UI tweak, or a simple workflow adjustment‚Äîcan have a huge impact for business users. But these ‚Äúsmall‚Äù requests often take longer than expected because they get caught in processes and development backlogs. 

That is why the recent blogs on ABAP AI and the Extensibility Assistant really resonate with me. They show how SAP is already delivering tools that make development faster and extensibility safer. 

Key Highlights You Should Explore 

Here are some excellent resources that set the stage for this journey: 

  •  @Simona Marincei‚Äôs Blog: ABAP AI Revolution: Accelerates the ABAP Developer Who Built Enterprise Apps 
  • @GeorgWilhelm‚Äôs Blog :  Extensibility Assistant for Key Users: The Extensibility Expert Right Next to You 
  • @AlexanderRother‚Äôs Blog:  ABAP AI Chapter 2 
  •  Joule for Developers ‚Äì YouTube Playlist 

Joule for Developers, ABAP AI Capabilities ‚Äì Free and Ready to Use 

One of the most exciting developments for us right now is Joule for Developers, ABAP AI Capabilities. It is available for free usage today and brings AI-powered assistance directly into the hands of developers. 

With Joule for Developers, you can: 

  • Generate and refactor ABAP code with AI guidance. 
  • Explore sample data and learning materials. 
  • Speed up everyday development tasks and reduce repetitive work. 
  • Access tutorials and demos from the YouTube playlist. 
  • For teams like mine, this is a real enabler‚Äîit means we are not just talking about AI as the future, we are using it today to accelerate delivery and learn new ways of working. 

What We Are Experiencing 

In my role, I see these tools helping in very practical ways: 

  • Business users get changes rolled out more quickly. 
  • Developers focus on high-value, complex scenarios. 
  • Projects move forward with smoother coordination. 

The result is a stronger partnership between IT and the business, and a better experience for everyone involved. 

Final Thought 

  • ABAP AI today is already making a difference‚Äîit accelerates development, empowers key users, and ensures safe extensibility with built-in governance. And with Joule for Developers ABAP AI Capabilities now free to use, every developer has the chance to explore AI-powered assistance directly. 
  • For me and my team, this means more delivered outcomes, happier stakeholders, and projects that stay on track. 

As I celebrate one year with this fantastic team, I look forward to what the next chapter will bring. The journey of ABAP AI is still unfolding, and I am excited to see where it takes us.  

 I would love to hear your thoughts: how are you using ABAP AI in your projects, and what impact has it had so far?

entry.title: Re: Horizon Theme and Templates for Stories in SAP Analytics Cloud
entry.content:
Hi all,
It appears that these Themes have an issue with line headers when you attempt to use styling rules or even "fill directly the cell".

For example, if you want to style an entire line, you are unable to do so. You can only style the data cells.

The reason is that the saptheme global CSS section "table--styled" has options set that are too restrictive there.

Even with overwriting via page CSS, it is not possible to fix:

.table--styled .sap-custom-table-column-row-headers{ 
background-color: #transparent;
}

The root cause is this line:

.saptheme .sap-custom-table-column-row-headers,
.table--styled .sap-custom-table-column-row-headers{
    background-color: transparent;
    color: #131e29;
}

The temporary solution is to create a dummy CSS class.

entry.title: Re: Traceability Log validity details
entry.content: Dear Customer, If you want to keep each traceability log, you can create an new functionality. Do one of the following: Choose Run With Traceability Log. Choose Run With Traceability Log Saved to [your remote folder location] if you have defined a remote folder location to store and read your traceability log file from. For more information, see Configure Destination for Remotely Stored CSV Files and Create a Mapping Job. Configure Destinations for Remotely Stored Folders or CSV Files https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_Group_Reporting_Data_Collection/e29950571a2b4065b1dacaf881c67413/9e69b6c7b0ca4f488caccc083957f25f.html?version=1.0

entry.title: SAP Customer Checkout Price Update Issue
entry.content:
SAP Customer Checkout is connected with CCO Manager, and all item master data is being synced from CCO Manager.

On certain POS systems, the price for some items is not updating correctly, and the issue appears randomly across items. After checking the SAP Customer Checkout database, I found that the updated price is reflected in the Price Discount entity. However, in cases where the price is not updating, both the old and the new prices are present in the Price Discount entity, and for some reason, CCO is still picking up the old price instead of the new one. Additionally, both entries have the same timestamp.

Since the client is currently live, this is causing significant disruptions in their operations. CCO Version 2.0 FP20 PL03

entry.title: NDC Converter 2.0: Automating Your Journey from BusinessObjects to Cloud Analytics
entry.content:
SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) provides a unified platform for data ingestion, semantic modeling, governance and analytics. For teams migrating from SAP BusinessObjects (BO), BDC enables:

  • A governed semantic layer in SAP Datasphere that faithfully reproduces and extends your existing BO universes with standardized naming conventions, hierarchies and calculated measures.
  • Cloud-native analytics in SAC for reporting, planning and predictive scenarios, powered by either live data connections or scheduled replication jobs.
  • A clear modernization path for SAP BW/4HANA artifacts and non-SAP sources, preserving embedded business logic while consolidating disparate models.

By porting Web Intelligence (WebI) content into BDC, you can retire legacy BO infrastructure and establish a sustainable foundation built on remote or replicated tables, graphical and SQL views and published semantic models that are fully consumable in SAC.

 

In this follow-up to our NDC Converter introduction, we‚Äôll showcase its newest capabilities and zoom in on how REST APIs, RPA and the SAP BDC stack work together to fully automate your migration workflow and eliminate uncertainty that is often associated with these sorts of projects.

Analysis & clean-up

Migration kicks off with a thorough source analysis powered by our enhanced scanning engine. After installing a lightweight Windows executable in your environment, NDC Converter uses the BusinessObjects REST API to perform a repository-wide scan - cataloging WebI documents, variables, filters and data sources. Parallel processing enables multiple report structures to be inventoried simultaneously, cutting traditional analysis times from days to hours.

If BO access is restricted, you can export a full content catalog instead and NDC Converter will generate a self-service metadata report for rapid sizing and compliance checks. These automated scans deliver hard metrics on:

  • Volume: total reports, pages, charts and objects
  • Complexity: calculations, variables, dimensions and interactive features
  • Usage: inactive or overlapping content

Armed with this detailed data, we can scope migration efforts accurately within days rather than weeks, giving prospects immediate insight into their BI landscape without manual, time-consuming analysis.

Automated report migration

Once WebI queries are identified, the next step is to align them with target system (usually SAP Datasphere but other options available too ‚Äì for reference see previous blog post). Steps here include:

  • Linking each WebI query to its target system
  • Generating the necessary migration definitions
  • Automatically provisioning and deploying the corresponding tables

If you‚Äôre working with many tables, the ‚Äúmass deploy‚Äù feature lets you push them live in bulk‚Äîno tedious one-by-one clicks.

After tables are deployed, we configure on-demand or scheduled data replication to maintain synchronization between target and source systems, followed by creating graphical and SQL-based views to implement calculation logic. The final step is to publish these views to SAP Analytics Cloud where up-to-date data can be accessed.

The data source layer migration involves analyzing the BO repository, migrating universe metadata and/or transitioning live models based on BEx queries. Upon completion of the initial data migration, a comprehensive semantic model is introduced that mirrors your original WebI structures including dimensions, measures, hierarchies and data. This transformation provides a cloud-ready foundation for all SAP Analytics Cloud initiatives.

NDC Converter 2.0

With your semantic model live, we proceed with WebI reports migration into SAP Analytics Cloud as interactive stories with new high functional coverage. NDC Converter retrieves each report‚Äôs layout, structures, tables, charts, filters and visual elements via the BusinessObjects REST API. A blueprint compatible with RPA processing is produced, covering:

  • Layout & structure: multi‚Äëpage documents, IDs, descriptions, pages/tabs.
  • Tables & crosstabs: calculated and restricted measures, variables and common WebI calculations.
  • Charts: Bar/Column, Line, Numeric Point, Pie, Donut, Heat Map, Tree Map, Bubble, Scatterplot.
  • Formatting & UX: predefined template stories, titles, text, headers/footers, icons.
  • Filters & interactivity: input controls, query filters, single object filters, drill, hyperlinks.

The RPA bot, delivered as a Chrome extension, reads this blueprint and automates the reconstruction of each report in SAC Story 2.0, preserving original tables, crosstabs, charts, parameters and filters. The resulting SAC Stories mirror your WebI reports while leveraging cloud-native data models.

What stays manual (and why)

NDC Converter automates routine migration tasks, allowing your team to focus on strategic design and governance ‚Äì here are cases where automation does not bring added value:

  • Data model (business semantics) design: turning technical structures into robust semantic layer requires continuous alignment on reporting vision.
  • Edge cases & redesign: in situations where 1:1 replication isn‚Äôt optimal, we propose a workaround solution to comply with business and technical needs.
  • Environment setup: Migrating users, roles and platform configurations using a mix of guided best practices and selective automation.

Collaborate end-end delivery

NDC Converter is an ideal tool for complex migration scenarios, automating the transfer of every structural element‚Äîfrom metadata and queries to filters and visual object definitions. Once the converter has recreated the report skeletons in SAC, your BI team can take over the final steps: refining layouts, adjusting chart properties and validating calculation logic. This collaborative workflow ensures that the most time-consuming technical migrations are handled automatically, while you retain full control over presentation, branding and business requirements.

entry.title: Re: Hiding sensitive Price information in Sales Order dis...
entry.content:
Hi @danny_loo 

Thank you for your question.

I recommend exploring KBA 2963264, Role-Based Access to Price Elements, Pricing & Adapting the UI for guidance.

In summary, using Access Restriction for Access to Price Elements is the right approach. However, in public cloud, the restriction framework controls mainly the Price Elements tab. If it was correctly configured, user will no longer be able to open or drill into condition records. However, summary fields like Net Value and Gross Value will remain visible. This cannot be hidden without authorisation objects.

  • For you to fully meet your requirement, you will need to combine two approaches:
  • First you will have to restrict price elements through IAM by setting the Access Price Elements to No Access.
  • Thereafter, you need to hide the net value/gross value through the UI function in the Sales Order app to removed net value field or item list and pricing header. Then publish the variant and assign it to the restricted role.

This way, any user can still open and track orders but they will not see pricing details anywhere.

I hope this provides the desired insight.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Changing Database connection via ApplyLogonInfo
entry.content:
Hi Bernhard,

Using the basic Logon info API's can't change the data source when it changes types.

You need to use RAS and ReplaceConnection() API, it uses old/new connection property bags.

See my Parameter test app on how to use RAS and API:

Related Documents

Crystal Reports for Visual Studio Licensing

See this Blog for instructions upgrading your existing project to the latest SP

See this blog on how to use CR 2020 Export to XLXS page formats:

How to use the new CR 2020 export to Microsoft Excel(XLXS) in Visual Studio .NET code (new)

how-to-parameters-in-crystal-reports-for-visual-studio-net

Printing Crystal Reports in .NET

Don

entry.title: A New Home for SAP Enterprise Support Value Maps on SAP Community
entry.content:
Does your organization have a cloud subscription from SAP?

If so, did you know you already have access to SAP Enterprise Support value maps as part of our foundational support offering ‚Äì included at no additional cost? That means direct access to specialized, product-level groups, curated enablement, and expert guidance.

And now, Value Maps have moved from SAP Learning Hub to a user-friendly platform within SAP Community, making them easier to navigate, more connected, and better aligned with your goals.

Why Value Maps?

Do you sometimes wish there was a clear path ‚Äì guided by people who know the terrain ‚Äì to help you navigate challenges, sharpen your skills, and find the expert enablement you need to move forward?

That‚Äôs what Value Maps are for.
They‚Äôre more than just a collection of material ‚Äì they‚Äôre expert-guided learning groups, giving you step-by-step support, targeted content, and direct access to experts who understand your needs.

What You Gain by Joining Value Maps

‚úîÔ∏è Structured Learning Navigate curated enablement content by topic and build your digital skills with flexible learning formats. Strengthen your capabilities through expert-led sessions and self-paced resources aligned with your business goals.

‚úîÔ∏èExpert Guidance Access advisory services tailored to your goals and challenges. Request a call with one of our topic experts to connect with the right content and resources ‚Äì and move forward with confidence.

‚úîÔ∏èContinuous Quality Checks and Improvement Services Work with our experts to analyze your system or solution using real-life data. Receive a detailed service report with an executive summary, key findings, and a clear action plan to optimize performance or mitigate risks.

‚úîÔ∏èPeer Collaboration and Knowledge Sharing Collaborate with SAP experts and industry peers to exchange strategies, share real-world experiences, and apply proven approaches. Gain insights that help you solve challenges faster and deliver stronger results across your projects.

‚úîÔ∏èOngoing Innovation Get early access to product updates, roadmap details, and release information. Use these insights to plan effectively, adapt systems with confidence, and ensure your organization benefits from the latest SAP innovations.

The Feature You Shouldn‚Äôt Miss: Request a Call 

Every Value Map includes the Request a Call option.

This is a guided conversation that points you to the most relevant enablement content and resources for your situation.

Whether you want to build a skill, choose the right learning path, or find resources that fit your project or scenario, a short call with an expert gets you moving faster.

Explore Topic-Specific Value Maps ‚Äì Built on Knowledge Bases

Every Value Map has a Knowledge Base ‚Äì  focused documents that organize learning content, best practices, and expert insights for your solution area or chosen topic.

Which group will help you right now?
  • Cloud ERP (Private or Public) ‚Äì Plan, implement, operate, and upgrade SAP S/4HANA Cloud at your pace.
  • Finance Management ‚Äì Enablement for financial processes including Quote-to-Cash.
  • Spend Management ‚Äì Resources for SAP Ariba, SAP Concur, and SAP Fieldglass.
  • Supply Chain Management ‚Äì From planning to manufacturing to EAM and SAP Business Network for Supply Chain.
  • Human Capital Management ‚Äì Guidance for SAP SuccessFactors.
  • Customer Experience ‚Äì Guidance for the SAP Customer Experience portfolio. Apply generative AI across sales, service, marketing, and e-commerce.
  • Business Transformation Management ‚Äì Resources for SAP Signavio and SAP LeanIX.
  • SAP Business Technology Platform ‚Äì Integrate, automate, and build on SAP BTP.
  • Data and Analytics ‚Äì Guidance for solutions including SAP Business Data Cloud, SAP Business Warehouse, SAP Analytics Cloud, SAP HANA Cloud, and SAP Databricks, as well as SAP BusinessObjects.
  • SAP Cloud ALM & Cross-Solution Topics ‚Äì Optimize SAP Cloud ALM, manage product lifecycles and secure your SAP landscape.
  • SAP Business AI, Clean Core & Sustainability ‚Äì Adopt AI, get your core system cloud-ready, and track sustainability goals.

Ready to explore?

Value Maps are part of SAP Enterprise Support‚Äôs commitment to your success. You already have access as part of your SAP cloud subscription ‚Äì start exploring today!

üëâ  Watch our short demo video, then head over to our page for more information and to get access. 

Don‚Äôt Miss Our Live Session!

We‚Äôre excited to announce an upcoming live event where we will demo SAP Enterprise Support value maps on SAP Community.

üìÖDate: October 22, 2025
üé•Session Title: LIVE SESSIONS on SAP Enterprise Support value maps ‚Äì Our Move to SAP Community

We encourage you to join the live session to see Value Maps in action ‚Äì or catch the replay if you can‚Äôt make it.

About the author:
Ami Patel is the Global Head of SAP Enterprise Support value maps. With‚ÄØmore than 20‚ÄØyears of experience at SAP and a diverse background in customer success leadership roles, Ami is passionate about helping customers succeed through SAP Enterprise Support offerings.

üí°Have questions or feedback around this content? Don‚Äôt hesitate to comment down below.

entry.title: SAP Integration Suite Deep Dive and Hands-on Event (Oct 22, 2025 Palo Alto)
entry.content:
Our SAP Integration Suite team is hosting an event at our SAP office's in Palo Alto @ SAP Building 1 on October 22, 2025.  

Whether you are just considering SAP Integration Suite and have a lot of questions, are new to the technology and still getting your feet wet, or are a seasoned user of SAP Integration Suite there is value for you at this event.   We will have SAP Integration Suite product experts leading all sessions at this one-day event.  

We will provide a deep-dive into the capabilities of SAP Integration Suite, take a tour of the latest roadmap, provide an overview of migration tools, services, and the latest financial promotions to make the move, provide a hands-on experience of SAP Integration Suite, and provide time to sit one-on-one with a product expert to get your questions answered.  

During this SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP) knowledge-exchange with our product management team, you will:

  • Gain a deeper understanding of SAP Integration Suite with a hands-on learning experience
    • SAP Integration Suite is a modern, scalable, and secure platform as a service (iPaaS), empowering businesses to integrate all applications and systems across SAP and non-SAP landscapes using one solution. It supports real-time data exchange, automation, and API-driven innovation, facilitating business processes across your entire ecosystem, including cloud, on-premise, and hybrid environments
  • Be inspired by a local SAP Integration Suite customer speaker sharing the keys to their success.
  • Dive into advanced use cases and capabilities, including:
    • Cloud Integration to build and run application-to-application (A2A), business-to-business (B2B), and business-to-government (B2G) scenarios with over 3,200 prebuilt integrations
    • Advanced Event Mesh to design, deploy, and manage an event-driven architecture (EDA) that enables real-time business processes at scale
    • Edge Integration Cell to support hybrid integration needs with a cloud or local runtime
    • API-Management to secure, govern, and transform your APIs with management and delivery processes that drive innovation while safeguarding against threats
  • Discover how to leverage the 2025 Transformation Incentive to save money on migration from SAP Process Integration, SAP Process Orchestration, or SAP Cloud Integration on the SAP BTP, Neo environment, and third-party solutions to integrate SAP and non-SAP systems

Register now and bring your laptop! Seats are limited for this hands-on event.

We look forward to seeing you on Wednesday, October 22, 2025, at SAP Building 1, 3410 Hillview Avenue, Palo Alto, CA 94304.

If you have any questions about the event please reploy to this post and we'll follow-up with you.

entry.title: Create 2 new fields in Job Info and Position Object as a mandatory fields
entry.content:
Hello All,

I have new requirement for create 2 new fields in the job info as well as in position object and we have written the sync rule for syn these 2 fields also.

these 2 fields is mandatory effective from 1st-Sep-2025 and for back date default value i have to set.

whicle we are updating back dated record before 1st-sep-2025 system through error msg mandatory field, but for now is there any feasibility to sync default value without uploading all history records in job and position object.

Thanks,

Aasif

entry.title: Re: LSMW issue in IE02 transaction
entry.content:
If you use LSMW, instead of creating a batch input recording for IE02, you should select the Standard Batch/Direct Input method and use the object for IBIP (program RIBIP00 ‚Äì Initial Load of Equipment Master Data).

That way, the LSMW will trigger IBIP in the background. It is far more stable than a recording of IE02, and in most cases the updates will go through correctly.

entry.title: Re: Error message "Service broker privatelink failed with...
entry.content: Private Link is a hyperscaler-dependent service, thus establishing a private link between two different hyperscalers is not possible. In your case, if you try to establish a private link to your CosmosDB account then you have to make sure that the SAP private link service instance is created from a BTP subaccount with Microsoft Azure as provider.
